author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أو بإعراضکم ینقص عنه شيء لا فوذاتي الغالب الممتنع المنیع أن أخرقوا حجبات الأسمآء وملکوتها فوجمالي قد ظهر سلطان الأسمآء الّذي بأمره خلقت الأسمآء من أوّل الّذي لا أوّل له ویخلقها کیف یشآء وإنّه لهو المقتدر الحکیم إیّاکم أن لا تعرّوا
translation: Say: Think ye that your allegiance to His Cause can ever profit Him, or your repudiation of its truth cause Him any loss? No, by My Self, the All-Subduing, the Inaccessible, the Most High! Tear ye asunder the veils of names and cleave ye their kingdom. By My Beauty! He Who is the Monarch of all names is come, He at Whose bidding every single name hath, from the beginning that hath no beginning, been created, He Who shall continue to create them as He pleaseth. He, verily, is the All-Powerful, the All-Wise.
